intro: Mesembryanthemum lehmannii, commonly known as the Cape gooseberry or ozarina, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, often hairy leaves and showy, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, and it produces small, round fruits that are edible. Mesembryanthemum lehmannii is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and drought tolerance.
